alpha.expert_suggestion: Adjust based on sample size, more conservative (lower) values for larger samples. If < 500, use 0.1; Else if 500-10000 (<10000 but >500), use 0.05; Else if > 10000, using 0.01.

indep_test.expert_suggestion: Choose based on data type, 'fisherz' for linear continuous data; 'chisq' for discrete data (only applied for pure discrete data); 'kci' for nonlinear data (very slow, use only with variable size < 15 and sample size < 1500); 'fastkci' is faster than kci (use with < 20 variables and sample size < 3000); 'rcit' is the fastest approximation of kci (use with < 30 variables and sample size < 5000).
